summary: This document is a subpoena issued by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney to Jordana Feldman, the Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (EVCP), commanding the production of documents related to accusers and the program. It includes the subpoena form, proof of service instructions, and the full EVCP Protocol detailing the program's purpose, administration, and claims process.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in criminal case 20CR330, whose defense attorney is requesting the subpoena for documents from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Jordana Feldman
persons.role: Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
persons.context: The person to whom the subpoena is directed, responsible for administering the compensation program for victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: The attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell who is requesting the subpoena, from the firm Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.

persons.name: Kenneth R. Feinberg
persons.context: Retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to help design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Camille S. Biros
persons.context: Retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to help design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Marci A. Hamilton
persons.context: A professor and sexual abuse expert who may be consulted by the Program Administrator to inform about the dynamics of sexual abuse and advise on policies.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose estate established the compensation program for victims of his alleged sexual abuse.

connections.description: Pagliuca is the defense attorney representing Maxwell in criminal case 20CR330, as indicated by his request for the subpoena.
Both were retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.
Both were retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.
Hamilton may be consulted by Administrator Feldman to provide expert advice on sexual abuse dynamics and program policies.
The document references individuals who have accused both Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell of misconduct.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to EVCP Administrator
events.description: A subpoena is issued by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney to Jordana Feldman, Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, commanding the production of documents related to accusers and the program.

events.title: EVCP Protocol Established
events.description: The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program Protocol is dated, outlining the purpose, administration, and claims process for compensating victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York, Courtroom 318, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C., 150 East 10th Ave., Denver, Colorado 80203
Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, 1050 Connecticut Ave., NW #65488, Washington, D.C. 20035
Probate Court of the United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team subpoenaed the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program for all material related to accusers, including claim forms, communications, payments, and releases.
The subpoena is part of criminal case 20CR330 against Ghislaine Maxwell.

The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program was established by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein and administered independently by Jordana Feldman, with design input from Kenneth Feinberg and Camille Biros.
The program allowed victims to file claims regardless of whether their claims were time-barred or they had previously settled with Epstein.
The program protocol explicitly states that claimants are not bound by confidentiality rules and are free to discuss their allegations, including with law enforcement.
